outcomes.explanation: Based on your answers, this item is likely acceptable for recycling if it is clean and dry.
tips: Empty, rinse, and dry the item before recycling
Remove mixed materials if possible (e.g., caps, liners)
If in doubt, use camera scan for confirmation
outcomes.instruction:
1. Rinse the bottle thoroughly.
2. Remove the cap.
3. Crush the bottle to save space.

outcomes.explanation: Food or liquid residue can contaminate recycling streams, so it should not go into the recycling bin as-is.
tips: Rinse and dry the item before recycling
If it cannot be cleaned, dispose as general waste
Avoid placing oily or heavily soiled items into recycling

outcomes.explanation: Electronic items should be handled separately and should not be placed in the blue recycling bin.
tips: Bring it to an e-waste collection point
Do not place e-waste into general recycling bins
If removable, separate parts like batteries for proper disposal

outcomes.explanation: Batteries require special handling and must not go into the blue bin.
tips: Bring batteries to designated battery recycling points
If possible, remove battery from device before disposal
Avoid damaging or puncturing batteries

outcomes.explanation: Wearable textiles in good condition are better donated or collected via textile channels rather than the blue bin.
tips: Donate to textile collection/donation points
Wash and bag clean clothing before donation
If unsure, use the app’s location finder (TODO) later

outcomes.explanation: Worn-out textiles may be accepted by textile recycling channels depending on condition and material.
tips: Bag the textile separately before drop-off
If wet/soiled, dry it first to prevent mold
If uncertain, try camera scan or check guidance (TODO)
